Articles.Content: My drill-o-matic Juniors are showing "N/A" for Ore Rate...yet my ore container is filling up slowly. Any idea why the "n/a"?

26 minutes ago, Victor3 said:

My drill-o-matic Juniors are showing "N/A" for Ore Rate...yet my ore container is filling up slowly. Any idea why the "n/a"?

 

It's a weird display glitch and seems to happen when you turn them on with action groups. If you toggle the drills off and on again individually you'll get the rate displayed again.

Edited February 8, 2018 by foamyesque
Doesn't seem to work that way for me? I don't use action groups and I start and stop my drills individually...still no ore rate.
Just a guess - you may need a surface scanner on your vessel for displaying the ore rate, cant test it myself at moment and i may be wrong.

You are on a surface with very  little ore, combine that with the inefficiency  of the small drills and probably with the absence of a engienieer, and you have Not A Number of ore rate ( it means that is very little/second)

13 hours ago, Flavio hc16 said:

You are on a surface with very  little ore, combine that with the inefficiency  of the small drills and probably with the absence of a engienieer, and you have Not A Number of ore rate ( it means that is very little/second)

I landed on the best area of Minmus, that was flat, for Ore content and I do have an engineer on site...but you may be right...I would have to go look at my orbiting scanner for ore percentage (Draalo, I do not have a surface scanner on any vessel that makes up my mining operation). Either way, I am getting Ore into my holding tank so it's all good. Was mostly curious.
Just checked my orbital scanner, it says 5.7% ore where I'm mining on Minmus.

Having same issue..

Two Engineers onboard, used action groups and also tried manually starting/stopping.

Manually starting gave me the readout.

Do you have landing legs on your ship?

Are they well touching the ground?
